title: The Star Wars Holiday Special SWHS (1978) 480p Rifftrax 2ch v2
description:
Star.Wars.Holiday.Special.1978.480p.Rifftrax.2ch.v2.mkv

DEFAULT AUDIO IS TRACK1 MOVIE PLUS RIFFTRAX
FOR MOVIE ONLY SOUND SWITCH TO TRACK2 FOR 2.0

THIS IS BASED ON THE ZION HYBRID EDITION AND INCLUDES COMMERCIALS

The Star Wars Holiday Special (1978)
video: 720x442 AVC
audio1 (default): tv special plus Rifftrax AAC 2.0
audio2: just tv special AAC 2.0
intro1: 1st half of Rifftrax intro at start of riff
opening and intro2: the opening riff comments about synching and donating along with the 2nd half of the Rifftrax intro are 1s after the last riff
Rifftrax released 2007.12.10 1h58m35s 935,986,656bytes
Riffers: Bill Corbett, Kevin Murphy, Mike Nelson
Movie IMDB: http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0193524/

This version2 has the following changes:
* v2 has a newly remastered 2.0 Riff track using Chris's Dynamic Compressor on the movie and Level Speech on the riffs
* v1's riff track was from the Zion Hybrid Edition
* new 2.0 Riff audio audio track has more balanced and understandable riffs
* the volume range for the riffs is much, much more consistent so even very quiet riff words are clear
* v2 2.0 Riff is 196Kbps vs v1 at 160Kbps

This is a remux with the Rifftrax commentary added as the default audio track. The Rifftrax audio track has been newly remastered to ensure the riff comments are just loud enough to be clear when the movie is loud and not too loud when the movie is quiet. Please leave any feedback regarding the Rifftrax audio remastering.

Big thanks to the Zion Hybrid Edition poster for this fantastic version from a WBBM Chicago 2nd generation VHS tape with commercials taken from the WMAR Baltimore broadcast. This share used the Zion Hybrid Edition (holiday special.iso 4.29GB) source to generate the AVC video track (2-pass, 700Kbps) and for the 2.0 Movie audio track.

How is this post different from the Zion Hybrid Edition DVD?
1. smaller, 892MB vs 4.29GB, with equivalent video and audio quality
2. the riff audio track is the DEFAULT but it can be changed to the non-riff version
3. the original picture had black bars on the top and bottom that were removed
4. new chapters with names!

If this Rifftrax was enjoyable, you haven't paid for it and you have some money to spare, please consider purchasing it via streaming or download (9.99USD) or make a general donation (5USD and up) - they take Bitcoin now too  

[Note, the Star Wars Holiday Special Rifftrax was originally available as an mp3 commentary for 3.99USD but is now 9.99USD for an integrated streaming or integrated file download. Making a 5USD donation is an option now that the mp3 commentary is not sold.]

Please check out other Rifftrax, Battlestar Galactica, DC Comics, documentaries, Star Trek Enterprise and more at:

Thanks, bsg4you
